title: Bindi Irwin shares family selfie before season two of Crikey! It's the Irwins premieres
text:
The second season of their much-loved show Crikey! It's the Irwins will premiere in Australia on October 19.

And to celebrate the highly-anticipated return, the family of late Steve 'Crocodile Hunter' Irwin shared a heartwarming selfie as they continue to keep his legacy alive.

Bindi, 21, took to Instagram to share the cute image, which showed her cuddled up to her doting mum while at the family's Australia Zoo in Queensland.

So sweet! On Friday, Bindi Irwin (centre) shared an adorable image alongside her mum Terri (left) and brother Robert (right) - two weeks before their show Crikey! It's the Irwins premieres on Animal Planet

Meanwhile her brother Robert, 15, proudly took the sweet selfie - and was pictured beaming alongside his doting family in full uniform.

Alongside the snap, Bindi gushed to her millions of followers: 'We are so excited for the season premiere of Crikey It’s The Irwins!' before confirming the release date.

The first season of Crikey! It's The Irwins - which airs on Animal Planet - gave viewers unprecedented access to the family's busy lives helping to run Australia Zoo in Beerwah.

Steve Irwin's daughter Bindi, who recently got engaged, revealed the second season of Crikey! It's The Irwins would premiere later this month

The documentary ranges from showcasing crocodiles at their zoo on the Sunshine Coast to the family's conservation work with wildlife around the globe.

The wildlife centre is owned by Terri, 55, having been first opened in 1970 by Steve's parents Bob and Lyn Irwin.

For the Irwins, the show isn't just about carrying a legacy, but about raising awareness.

It's back! The first season of Crikey! It's The Irwins gives viewers unprecedented access to the family's busy lives helping to run Australia Zoo in Beerwah, Queensland

'The most important role for our family is getting this message out,' Terri said in season one of the show.

Bindi agreed, adding: 'It is so important for us to stand up and speak for those who can't speak for themselves.

'Especially with animals like crocodiles, snakes and spiders ... creatures that might not be cuddly and fluffy.'

The Irwins! When Steve died 12 years ago, he left behind wife Terri, daughter Bindi and son Robert, now 15. The family are pictured at Australia Zoo here in 2006

Steve's widow Terri has also admitted she's not worried about Robert suffering the same fate as he follows in his father's footsteps.

'I am more worried about him drowning than encountering a shark or a Manta ray in the water,' she told The Australian Women's Weekly.

Robert is a keen conservationist just like his late father, and is also a talented photographer who documents underwater wildlife.

Meanwhile, Bindi recently her 21st birthday by getting engaged to her long-term boyfriend Chandler Powell - and the pair recently aptly confirmed their wedding venue as Australia Zoo in 2020.

Bride to be! Bindi recently her 21st birthday by getting engaged to her long-term boyfriend Chandler Powell (left)
description: The second season of their much-loved show Crikey! It's the Irwins will premiere in Australia on October 19 - and to celebrate, the family shared a gorgeous selfie with fans.
authors: Charlie Coe For Daily Mail Australia
